item.title: Bins not emptied for over 4 weeks, 5th July
item.description:
Hello, the bins along the footpath around Morden Wharf and along the whole path up to the Intercontinental hotel have not been emptied for over four weeks. I collected some littler from the river banks, left the bin bags next to the bin and the fixed bin and all the around the whole path has been there for more than 4 weeks. Why is this path not kept clean with collections every week??

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Morden Wharf Road, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs pruning, 5th July
item.description:
Tree branches here (outside239) and along the entire street are very low and need to be cut back as there is a blind person living in a property near the tree and they are having issues all the time with hitting into the branches here and long the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Anerley, London

item.title: M and s garage aircon flooding the pavements in green slime, 5th July
item.description:
Air con vents at m and s have been flooding the pathways and crossing over the road for the last few years. The water is turning to algae and causing the pathways to become slippery. This is unsightly abd unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, West Park, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned estate agent signs, 5th July
item.description:
We have multiple estate agent signs that have been left up for months after properties have been let/sold. These are held in place by metal ties that are difficult to remove, and have excessively weathered and rusted due to the prolonged time they've been in place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 209, Charlton Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 288, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Regular fly tipping in communal bins, 5th July
item.description:
We have regular fly tipping occurring in our communal bins over at least the last 3 years that I've lived here, and from hearing from others here going further back. This includes large items and business waste that the council regular collection doesn't remove. This has resulted in us being charged for removal through our service charge despite it not being the property occupiers' fault.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 209, Charlton Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
